Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals

Class FileDirHandler

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.FileDirHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class FileDirHandler extends Object implements Serializable
Static functions used to manipulate driver application property files and paths. These functions create, delete, copy, and manipulate file/directories.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • FileDirHandler

      public FileDirHandler()

  • Method Details

    • setCopyBufferSize

      public static void setCopyBufferSize​(int cbs)
      Set the file buffer copy size to cbs MB.
      Parameters:
      cbs - The new file buffer copy size (in MB).

    • directoryExtension

      public static String directoryExtension​(String dir)
      Returns the ending directory name extension of the form "_#" if one exists. If not "" is returned.
      Parameters:
      dir - The input directory name for which the ending extension will be returned. If one is not found "" is returned.
      Returns:
      The ending extension of the input directory (dir) or "" if one is not found.

    • findFile

      public static String findFile​(String inFile, String ext)
      Finds the first occurrence of a file with the input extension. If none are found an empty string is returned. If more than one are present the first one discovered is returned.
      Parameters:
      inFile - The input path to search for a file with extension ext.
      ext - The extension of the file to return from the input directory.
      Returns:
      The path/file if found or empty ("") if not.

    • newDirectory

      public static String newDirectory​(String startPath, String startDir, int filNumLimit)
      Finds the first non-existing directory, which may be "startDir", or "startDir_#", where # is some integer 1 to filNumLimit; and returns the result to the caller. The input "startPath" is prepended to "startDir" with a file separator unless it is null or empty.
      Parameters:
      startPath - The starting path to the first non-existing directory to be discovered.
      startDir - The starting guess for the first non-existing directory to be discovered.
      filNumLimit - The maximum allowed file name number limit.
      Returns:
      The first discovered non-existing directory startDir_#

    • createOutDir

      public static void createOutDir​(String outputLogFilePath, String propertiesFileName) throws IOException
      Creates the directory defined by outputLogFilePath and copies the input properties file into that directory.
      Parameters:
      outputLogFilePath - The output file path directory to be created.
      propertiesFileName - The name of the input properties file that will be copied into the directory.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • createDirectory

      public static void createDirectory​(String dirPath) throws IOException
      Creates the input directory dirPath. The function throws a IOException if the path already exists or could not be created.
      Parameters:
      dirPath - The directory to be created.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • copyFile

      public static File copyFile​(String inFilePath, String outFilePath) throws IOException
      Copy file from inFilePath to outFilePath, overwriting the destination file if it exists.
      Parameters:
      inFilePath - input file
      outFilePath - output file
      Returns:
      true on success
      Throws:
      IOException

    • initializeDirectory

      public static String initializeDirectory​(String basePath, PropertiesPlus props, ScreenWriterOutput scrnWrtr, boolean... appnd) throws IOException
      Defines, initializes, and sets the "ioDirectory" property.
      Parameters:
      basePath - The input IO directory base path.
      props - The properties file.
      scrnWrtr - The screen writer
      appnd - Opens to log file for append if true.
      Returns:
      The new "ioDirectory" path.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • initializeDirectory

      public static String initializeDirectory​(String basePath, String subPath, PropertiesPlus props, ScreenWriterOutput scrnWrtr, boolean... appnd) throws IOException
      Defines, initializes, and sets the "ioDirectory" property.
      Parameters:
      basePath - The input IO directory base path.
      props - The properties file.
      scrnWrtr - The screen writer
      appnd - Opens to log file for append if true.
      Returns:
      The new "ioDirectory" path.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • prependDate

      public static String prependDate​(String inFName)
      Prepends the current date string "yyyy_MM_dd" to the front of the input string replacing the occurrence "(DATE)" if it is present. Otherwise the input string is simply returned.
      Parameters:
      inFName - The input string for which "(DATE)" will be replaced with the current date.
      Returns:
      The new input string with "(DATE)" replaced with the current date string.

    • setOutputWriterMode

      public static void setOutputWriterMode​(PropertiesPlus props, ScreenWriterOutput scrnWrtr) throws IOException
      Sets the screen/file output modes for the GeoTomography, IODB, and LSQR writers based on the output model property
      Parameters:
      props - The properties object from which the "outputMode" is read.
      scrnWrtr - The ScreenWriterOutput object whose output mode is set.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • createOutputLogFileWriter

      public static void createOutputLogFileWriter​(String outPath, ScreenWriterOutput scrnWrtr, boolean... appnd) throws IOException
      Creates the output file "out.txt" in the directory outPath. The output file is assigned to the input ScreenWriter object scrnWrtr.
      Parameters:
      outPath - The output file path where the "out.txt" file will be written.
      appnd - If true append to an existing file.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • copyDirToArchive

      public static boolean copyDirToArchive​(File fromDir, File newParentDir)
      Copy an entire directory to a new location under the given parent archive directory. This is used to copy results from a temporary location to a stable, backed up location. For example, copying results from "eel" to "thummper".
      Parameters:
      fromDir - directory to copy over
      newParentDir - parent directory to put a copy of fromDir underneath
      Returns:
      true on success, false on failure
      Throws:
      IOException

    • deleteRecursive

      public static boolean deleteRecursive​(File ddir) throws IOException
      Recursive file/directory delete function. If the input directory is a file it is simply deleted and success or failure (true or false) is returned to the caller. If it is a directory then all of its content files are deleted and any content directories are recursively deleted by recalling this function for each. If a delete fails an IOException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      ddir - The input file/directory to be recursively deleted.
      Returns:
      True if delete was successful.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • extractFileName

      public static String extractFileName​(String filePathName)
      Extract a filename from filepathname, with possible extension
      Parameters:
      filePathName -
      Returns:
